intro: Epithelantha petri, commonly known as the petri's cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the Cactaceae family. It is native to the arid regions of Mexico, where it thrives in rocky and well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is a perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters. Epithelantha petri is well adapted to drought conditions, with spines that provide protection and reduce water loss.
